title.narrative: EDUCATION:MIGRATION RESPONSE

description.narrative: Children on the move are supported to access education opportunities while enhancing capacity of schools in host communities., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

participating-org.narrative: ASSOC VOLUNTARIOS PARA O SERVICO INTERNACIONAL

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children on the move are supported to access education opportunities while enhancing capacity of schools in host communities.

description.narrative: UNICEF leads the education sector and its response, having built up efforts for the provision of non-formal education services, for the identification, documentation, and enrollment of out of school children and adolescents. The strategies include maintaining 26 child friendly spaces that befitted almost 14,000 boys and girls, provision of education services, training of almost 800 professionals, distribution of learning material, supporting local authorities for their sufficient and adequate response, including sensitization on indigenous specific needs, and awareness raising on protection, gender, and xenophobia. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2022
